title: Why companies should stop trying to be “AI-first”
content:
Artificial intelligence has become a buzzword in the tech industry. Companies are eager to present themselves as “AI-first” and use the terms “AI,” “machine learning,” and “deep learning” abundantly in their web and marketing copy. What are the effects of the current hype surrounding AI? Is it just misleading consumers and end-users or is it also affecting investors and regulators? How is it shaping the mindset for creating products and services? How is the merging of scientific research and commercial product development feeding into the hype? These are some of the questions that Richard Heimann, Chief AI Officer at Cybraics,…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: When AI itself becomes our goal, we lose sight of the problems we must solve. And by extension, we draw the wrong conclusions and make the wrong decisions.
